alert.note: Alert for Coastal Brunswick; Coastal New Hanover; Coastal Pender; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover; Inland Pender (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 4:14PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of New Hanover, southeastern Pender and eastern Brunswick Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 414 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cape Fear Community College North Campus, or near Figure Eight Island, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Leland, Oak Island, Carolina Beach, Wrightsville Beach, Kure Beach, Caswell Beach, Bald Head Island, South Masonboro Island, Snows Cut, Ocean Crest Pier, Rich Inlet, Yaupon Beach, North Masonboro Island, Figure Eight Island, Hampstead, Boiling Spring Lakes, St. James, Southport, and Hightsville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 413 and 416. Interstate 140 between mile markers 15 and 20. US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 41 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Brunswick; Coastal New Hanover; Coastal Pender; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover; Inland Pender
